summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for July 12, 2019. It details routine operational activities, inmate counts, movements, and incidents, including the placement of an inmate on suicide watch after a use of force. The logs show the facility's operations on the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Immediate Use of Force on Inmate Grayson
events.description: At 3:20 PM, correctional officers used immediate force on inmate Grayson (#70887-054). Following the incident, the inmate was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Multiple Inmates Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Throughout the evening, six inmates (Santiago, Ramirez, Guzman, Peralta, Tolentino, Morcillio) were moved to ZA (likely a special housing or investigation unit) pending investigation, as formally listed in the administrative detention section.

events.title: Routine Facility Operations and Counts
events.description: The log details standard correctional center operations for July 12, 2019, including multiple institutional counts, equipment checks, inmate movements for court and hospital, and shift changes among lieutenants.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the logged activities took place. This is where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

locations.name: Local Hosp
locations.context: Referenced as the location where inmates Cherry and Burnett were taken, accompanied by USMS guards.

keyFacts: This log documents the routine operations at the MCC on July 12, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
An 'immediate use of force' was reported on inmate Grayson (#70887-054) at 3:20 PM, resulting in the inmate being placed on suicide watch.
Several inmates, including Gebremariam and Grayson, were listed as being on psychological observation or suicide watch, indicating mental health monitoring within the facility.
Six inmates were placed in administrative detention (ZA) 'pending investigation' during the evening shift, as detailed in a separate list within the document.
The logs note system malfunctions preventing PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcements from being made over the public address system during the day and evening shifts.
